description: THE place to go with a large group for good quality food/sake BOMBS and better service! Christy was amazing and made sure that our night was flawless. The sushi was fresh and tasted . Go for a good time and YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT!!
author: Jacquie T.

description:
Went here as party of 2. Not very busy. Two waitstaff. Polite but not engaging. 
Someone wanted the all you can eat. For weekends it's $33 with mandatory 18% gratuity. 
Food was 6.5/10. 
Had an odd club atmosphere. 
Wouldn't do again. 
If you are drunk and want to fill up on okay food. Go here. 
For two people, $88.66. 

If the food was a notch up, would give an extra star. 
At least everyone was polite enough, just could imagine when it's busy how the service would be. 

Could barely taste the California roll. 
At least the fried stuff was fine. Tonkatsu, chicken Katsu. 
The rolls were forgettable.
author: Chris A.

description:
Sushi Bar or Time Machine!

Sushi Hunter has been around for almost 18 years, but this was the first time I had an opportunity to check it out. I stopped by to get an Udon to go, so my 3 star rating is more of an incomplete than anything else!

As soon as I walked in I was struck by the decoration. I will not be exaggerating if I said that it is something out of the 60s or 70s. It took me a while to adjust! With that said the young lady who greeted me was very nice, took my order and asked me if I would like anything while I wait. I asked for a green tea that never materialized, but I didn't care since I was not really craving it!

The Chicken Udon arrived in about 10-15 minutes. I must say that it was very nicely wrapped! You know how it is? You get an Udon to go and by the time you get home half of it has spilled in the bag! Not this time and that is a good thing because it was very tasty and hit the spot for me. I will have to stop by again and try a few other dishes.
author: Afshin A.

description:
Wow we just spent 30 min debating over $6 bill.  And they lost our repeat business.  

I called beforehand to ask how much all you can eat  is for kids 6 and 9 year old. They said half price.  So we came in and confirmed again and they said yes.  

Food was okay although she kept getting our order wrong and then kept telling me that i was wrong.  So odd since I knew exactly what I ordered.  It's all you can eat anyways.  We just wanted to make sure we didn't waste any food. 

Then bill took 10 min to come and they decided to charge us $18 a kid vs $15.  We asked and they said well the menu always said $18 for kids 5-11.  We looked at the menu and pricing for kids was nowhere to be found.  

Then she took 20 more min to deduct $6 while arguing that well the price was there before as if we were supposed to know that from a menu she no longer has.  It was the oddest experience to have such petty incompetent service and response.  

We used to like coming here.  Now it's off our list and I hope it was worth it for them to do this for $6 just so they want to make sure to tell us they were right, even though nothing is printed anywhere.  

They lost our trust and therefore hard to also trust the quality of food.  Ugh.  Will not be back.
author: Lei H.

description:
Came here last night with 5 others for what was all of our first times with AYCE (all you can eat) sushi. We made a reservation for 8pm, showed up 5 minutes early, got our table immediately. The waiter helped us out in ordering food for our first round, as we were all unsure what to get.

Like others have said, the food was good but nothing special. My personal favorite was the Crunch Roll, and there were a few other good-tasting rolls out there (Wild Fire roll, Rock'n Roll). But the rest was meh. I despised the maki and the nigiri wasn't too tasty, which left a lasting impression.

The service was good for us -- the waiter would come by to take our plates and orders whenever we finished a round, brought more water frequently, and were helpful in general.

I am disappointed by the price, however. For $30 AYCE, I expected more. $30 isn't even accurate because they add tax and then the 18% gratuity. So for 6 people, $180 AYCE becomes $230, meaning we all just paid close to $40 for decent AYCE sushi.

Overall, I wouldn't come back here again without trying out (or at least reading through more reviews of) other AYCE sushi restaurants nearby.
author: Rahul R.

description: There's no way all u can eat sushi can be tasty right? Wrong. It can! Combined with their attentive service who know how to have a good time this place is my now two time bday fun night out. My favorite food is sake nigiri (salmon basically) and it isn't like this is the best I have ever had but it is easily in the top half and quite tasty. I ate all of these and then another plate too.
author: Jason P.

description: They charged me $38 for a meal that was supposed to be $29 affirmed beforehand.  He talked to the girl on the register,  then said it was gratuity.  Why was there a tip space included and what if I didn't check?
author: Jeff L.

description: Love Sushi Hunter. Excellent food in the center of North Beach. Everytime I came I asked for all you can eat. The place is small and cozy. People are friendly and the price is fair.
author: Fábio Z.

description: Drive all the way here and they did not open according to their hours online or on their phone message. Left standing outside with a locked door!
author: Bob T.

description:
Sushi Hunter seems to have a philosophy of "cheapness" pervading their whole business... except for the bill, that is. The interior looks minimum-decoration-required-cheap, their furniture feels high-school-cafeteria-cheap, and their rolls taste I-could-do-this-better-cheap. And judging by their attitude, I don't think the staff is too thrilled to be working at a restaurant where even they wouldn't eat the food.
But let's get one thing straight: this is a lower tier sushi restaurant with an all-you-can-eat option, which is the only reason I stepped foot inside. You know as well as I do that all-you-can-eat sushi at $27 per person (+18% gratuity, did ya catch that one?) is not the kind of sushi that will send you home happy. It's the kind that will send you to the bathroom unhappy.

Once you've agreed to this common understanding, you can at least take comfort in the fact you will be stuffed silly by the end of your meal... Or will you? We desperately tried about every option available to us, hoping to land a winner. Plate after plate of small flavorless rolls. How long will you last? Can you eat your money's worth? At Sushi Hunter, the value of the all-you-can-eat is wholly a question of your mental endurance rather than physical. Good luck, you'll need it.
author: Stephen C.

description:
Service was horrible and the food was disappointing. It all started with the server who brought us water and a single cup of tea. The thing is that we didn't order tea so we were confused. We asked if the tea was free and she nodded so we thought sure why not free tea. It took a while for them to give us the menu and also took longer for them to come around to take our orders. After we finally ordered, the server set a bowl of edamame on our table. We didn't order edamame so we asked if it was free. She said yes so we helped ourselves. Little did we know they were in fact NOT free. When the check came, they charged us for all the things that they said were free. In the end, the manager gave us a cash refund after we pointed out the mistakes on the bill which I'm giving it a one star. Adding another star because she helped take a group photo of our party. 

Food didn't have much flavor and the presentation was below average. Portion was small. Not at all satisfied with the food quality and service. It was a very confusing and stressful dining experience.
author: Ying Z.

description: It would help a lot if y'all keep it updated y'all prices online so that customers know what they are walking in to. Was planing a trip here with friends but then was looking in to prices and online it says one thing and then when I walked in it said another.
author: Yaya D.

description:
Came on a Wednesday evening around 6:30PM, sat at the bar for 1. 
Service was good. Informed them I wanted the AYCE and they gave me the AYCE menu. Placed order few minutes later, and first order (4 items) was served 5 minutes later. The speed of order to receiving the food was similar for the next few rounds. My tea was also regularly refilled. Went about 5ish rounds, and at next "ordering round" when I said I think I'm ready for the check, the waitress even politely asked "are you sure?" in a nice fun manner. I laughed and went for one more order for "dessert". 
Total was $27.00 for AYCE (Mon-Thurs) and $1.00 for the green tea. 
The first 2 rounds of tuna seemed slightly room-temperature and not as "firm". Probably was the remaining pieces of a large piece that had been sitting out from the refrigerator for an hour or so. Not bad, just noticiable. However by round 3ish (7:30pm-ish) the tuna was definetely a colder firmer one, which were good. 
Overall, for $30ish non-buffet style AYCE sushi in the city, I liked it and will definetely be coming back, espcially now that Monster Chef in Half Moon Bay is only open Fri-Sun.
author: Alvin N.

description:
This is the best all you can eat sushi place.  

They don't over pack the rolls with rice and they have the widest variety of offerings that I've seen for an all you can eat sushi spot.   $25 - $30 dollars a person.  

If you have a friend who can eat, this is the place to go.  My only gripe is that they don't bring you what you want.  With all you can eat menu's they tend to lose your order (especially if you're ordering a lot), so make sure to remind them and don't get too upset since you're at an all you can eat. 

They have everything from cooked dishes, nigiri, rolls, salads, soups and more on the all you can eat menu.
author: Justin L.

description: Great name of the restaurant by the way, the name is very catchy :) I've been here several times to do all-you-can eat sushi for 28 dollars. You can order your food upon request, which makes it much much more fresh than already made, catered sushi buffets. My usual go-toe are salmon and eels. I could just ordered that, and nothing else :) We also got ahi tuna, yellow tail, seaweed salad, California roll, tempora rolls, and some veggie rolls. They have enough vegetarian & vegan options. If you are looking for a great sushi place with no burden on the portion, this would be the place.
author: Lisa O.

description: We went for dinner on a Friday evening. Sushi was average. Atmosphere extremely loud due to multiple tables with younger crowds having sake bombs banging at tables and yelling. Service was extremely slow too and to top it off, they automatically charged us an 18% tip (claiming we were a party of 6) when in fact we were 2. And after charging my credit card, they even removed the itemized receipt to try to get yet an extra tip... very sneaky! I guess it works with some big drinking parties but not with us. Very upsetting! Beware
author: Miguel B.

description: The sushi was the lowest quality possible not worth the price whatsoever. If you're looking for cheap sushi in San Francisco I'd check out kitaro sushi way better than this and though it's not all you can eat it's a great price and you get so much sushi for how much you pay, here the food is so gross that you only eat a bit then you're done because it's that gross. Horrible service as well, the the tip is included so the waitress didn't care at all. Never going here again I don't know how a place like this survives in this city.
author: Sierra W.

description: I stopped here to grab a quick bite at 7 pm, I was the only customer. Three employees saw me, no one said hi for a min. Got seated, order taken, and a glass of water were all done quickly. I ordered the spicy tuna sushi roll $8. Was not spicy. Tasted like tuna rolled in rice. I was hungry so I didn't care. I finished at about 7:25 pm. The waitress asked if I would like the check, I said yes. She was polite, but I could hear her bickering with the manager or owner or maybe her father (who knows). 10 min go by, I finally had to ask another guy for the check. As he walked away, the woman came over with the check. She took my card. Waiting for the receipt to sign, I could hear the waitress still bickering with the "manager". I signed the receipt at 7:40 pm. Besides one couple who sat after me, I was the only one in the restaurant. I normally don't do good or bad reviews, but I felt I should say something because I saw a sign that said best sushi in SF...2 stars for the waitress for being polite me to my face.
author: Melanie R.

description:
I came here with my girlfriend and sister, and thought the sushi buffet was a really good deal. $30 (after 18% gratuity, more like $38) per person is not bad, considering there are options to order ngiri and different kinds of katsu for the all you can eat option. 

The service might be a little slow, but overall I thought it was a great deal for the price. A neat spot in the heart of North Beach, I'll definitely be back!
author: John F.

description: I liked it. The sashimi was fresh AF, there were limited rolls on the menu, but what we ordered was pretty tasty. If you like to get muffed up on saki bombs and fill your face with sushi, this is a good spot.
author: Jenna P.

description:
The food was good but nothing special. The service as Ok. The place is not noisy. However, their "All you can eat happy hour" is a bit of false advertisement.  The menu is limited. Maybe half of their regular menu. There is also a restriction "No more than 5 items fomr the same group". IN other words, you can only have 5 nigiri pieces or 5 rolls. You can also have 5 appetizers. Such a tremendous deal.
They also automatically add 18% gratuity to their bill. Well, I usually tip 20% but if they want to do 18, who am I to argue?  I gave them my credit car and the cc receipt , the kind you sign,  had empty tip line on it. I can totally see someone falling for it and double tipping.

It is an average place overall.
author: Margarita B.

description: My friend told me about this place, so we took the decision to try it today, unfortunately was an horrible experience, we ordered like 8 different kind of rolls, they put them all in same plate without even asking us, the presentation as you can see in the pic is terrible, the service so slow, and when we asked for ginger they bring us a very small quantity not enough even for one person, I'm giving them 2 stars because the food taste was quite fine, they need to do more effort, for sure I'll not come back again
author: Prince O.

description: Delicious dishes of sushi. Ayce. Can't get enough if their house hot sake. Just 13$ more for all you can drink!
author: Karli K.

description:
Came here with a friend last week for a rare AYCE sushi experience in San Francisco. Left very disappointed. Price was higher than acceptable, and food was very much below standard.

Their AYCE sushi menu gives limited choices, at least compared to what I'm used to from AYCE. They had a larger than usual roll selection (which isn't even appealing), but not nearly as many appetizers and you'd expect - and even more limited in seafood appetizers.

Their crunchy rolls were good, but in general had too much flour (too much crunch). Beyond that, the rolls were mediocre, and forgettable.

Appetizers were standard, tasted decent. Teriyaki chicken was lacking flavor, but props to good Gyoza.

Their salmon nigiri was quite nice, but that is the only nigiri I would recommend. The eel nigiri is alright, but feels old and overcooked, and the lean tuna nigiri is terrible (rubbery and chewy). The squid nigiri (or whatever the white rubber is) was absolutely the worst piece of sushi I'd tasted in that USA. I couldn't finish it. Some watery oily liquid filled my mouth when I bit into it. In hindsight, I should have complained.

There are no free desert options, so my friend and I opted for tomago nigiri. This was a mistake. Also couldn't finish this piece. Had to pay 2$ each for the kochi ice cream (which was tiny and hard, not mochi like at all).

The worst part is - the tip is pre-calculated into into your bill. THAT IS NOT A TIP, THAT IS A MANDATORY FEE. Ended paying 40 per person, when AYCE in Waterloo gives you a significantly more fulfilling experience for 22USD.
author: Ben Z.

description:
Holy cow! What can I not say about this place! First off, I didn't find this place! My bae did. Well we both were craving for some sushi and the first thing that popped up was sushi hunter! Wow. Reading all these reviews where everyone made it sound so delicious that we had to try this place!

Me and bae, initially was really excited about trying an AYCE sushi place in SF! Once we stepped inside, we weren't even greeted or acknowledged until like 8 minutes later or so by this blonde, when obviously the place was pretty empty. Well we sat at the very back which was a bummer but oh well. After looking at the menu for like 5 minutes, we were ready to order, thus we tried to get her attention. I swear she saw us but she just ignored us and then like 5 minutes later a new waitress comes out to take our order! They didn't give us no water or asked if we would like anything to drink and when we did ask for some ice water, they forgot to give it to us until the third time we asked! Like seriously!!?? Well okay we can excuse that I guess since we both were just hungry and wanted food!

HOLY COW, ONCE OUR FIRST ORDER OF SUSHI CAME IN, WE WERE SHOCKED BY THE APPEARANCE! It looked like just some garbaged dropped on the plates.. The sushi nigiri sure WASNT FRESH at all! Tasted and smelled hella fishy.. Sorry but not sorry and then the other rolls were not even good! There definitely was too much rice and the fillings inside was bland.. The rice itself had too much Vinegar and it was too mushy like baby food.. The fuck.. Well we basically only tried a couple of items and they were all gross... Also when we tried asking for the check, it took them like 15 extra minutes to give it to us. Like are you fucken serious! 

overall:
*Horrible customer service
*Food sucks(sorry but there must be something wrong with these yelpers who have been speaking so highly about this place... Nothing good at all.. I guess some people don't know what good quality sushi taste like)
*you get what you pay for ( I rather had quality over quantity)
*never coming back
*EVERYTHING TASTED THE SAME! Not what good sushi is supposed to be like!
author: Shirley G.

description:
All you can eat and made to order.  Sushi rolls are standard that is nothing unusual in combinations.  But the fish is fresh and tasty.  Large selection to choose from.

Will definitely be back!

Great salmon!
author: Amanda H.

description:
I would not recommend the all you can eat special. It's listed as $30 per person and we ended up paying $40 each since we missed the fine print: 18% gratuity is included.

The rolls were basic and mediocre, and it was clear that our orders took a bit longer since priority was given to customers ordering a la carte
author: Stephanie T.

description: Literally eating. Pulled a hair out of my sushi roll. Then a few mins later so did my date. seriously?! And they look over at us pulling them out. Don't even come by to say is everything okay? Disgusting. Couldn't even eat it. Never going back again. Oh and makes sense why there is hair everywhere. They don't even wear hair nets
author: Karlee A.

description:
Service: Very slow and bad service. We got the all you can eat, but the servers seemed to be reluctant to take orders and it actually took about 30 minutes each time we ordered. 

We were ordering, but the server cut us off and said, "I think this is enough for now." 

Sushi quality: below average. They were all dry and not very fresh.  Do not recommend.

Overall: rude owner, slow and poor service, bad food quality, over-priced.
author: Matt C.

description:
I tried again. This place still hasn't at least have the respect to make proper sushi rice. Just over cooked white rice. 

The end all was the salmon skin roll with I don't know what the fuck on it as some type of garnish. Literary look like shavings from when you sharpen your pencil. 

My wife likes this place. I guess she's going to have to find another place to go to.
author: Henry W.

description:
Thoroughly UNDERwhelming. 
They may have AYCE sushi, but its not worth the anguish of watching the faces of the sushi chefs and staff. They look miserable and the food waa not much better.  l've eaten at more than 50 AYCE sushi bars all over the U.S. and waa shocked at how bad a San Francisco sushi bar could be. 

1. Sushi chef in front of me was too busy squatting down hiding below the bar texting to take orders and get the food out. And no, he does not wash his hands when he goes right back to the rice. Yuk!
2. When three rolls came out on one plate, toward the end we were disgusted to see two black hairs on the plate that were previously covered with sushi rolls. Upchuk...
3. DO NOT even think about asking for the chef to make an avocado and cucumber roll...IT'S NOT ON THE MENU. Yes, you can have an avocado roll. Yes, you can have a cucumber roll. You cannot put those two items together since that combo is not already on the menu.
4. It goes on and on, but I've lost steam sharing how bad the experience was. 
5. Wait, he just squatted to have another texting session, but popped up fairly quickly and reached right for the yellow tail....mmmm good.

PS..wrote the review and posted while waiting for check.  Guess what? It gets worse, they added an automatic 18% tip for two people who had terrible service. They automatically add 18% to all checks. RUN. Don't walk.
author: Jenny B.

description:
Smallish size sushi joint. Went here with 5 other friends. One of our friends visited from Washington DC and was craving AYCE sushi. Originally we were debating on going to Another AYCE place in Daly City, but none of us felt like driving that far. 

Variety of sushi was ok, but the quality and portion size was not so good. The nigiri though fresh had this strange texture and the rice portions were large. The rolls also had too much rice and to be honest all of the rolls began to taste the same. They also took out my favorite rolls: lion king and dragon roll. SAD! 

The portions for appetizers was tiny, as in 1 person portions, so make sure after you think of your number double it!

The one good thing about the meal was the service. The server, whenever we flagged them down promptly took our orders and go is the food in a timely manner. 

Considering the price and quality of the food, we agreed we probably wouldn't come back again. However, it was nice that the meal time wasn't timed so we had all the time in the world to just sit, chat, and hang out while we eat.
author: Melissa N.

description: I was very upset with the quality of the sushi. When we got there, there was only 2 people which was definitely a red flag to begin with. This is not a good place if you expect the sushi to be fresh. You could definitely tell that the sushi had been stored for at least a week and it was super dry with hardly and flavor. And the all you can eat had very little variety. I'd recommend RB sushi instead of this place.
author: Abigail G.

description: This is an amazing sushi restaurant. They have a great selection and the sushi is fresh and ready pretty quickly. It's reasonably priced for sushi in the city. Easy to find and the decor is so appealing. Nice atmosphere, friendly staff, and a great family/date place. The four stars are for the service. The waitress was incredibly sweet but never stopped to ask us how the food was or if we needed anything else so we didn't have water for most of our meal. And getting her attention wasn't easy. She also brought out our check but ran out 5 minutes later and said she gave us the wrong bill. She actually just forgot to add things to our bill like our appetizer and our drinks. The service just needs to be worked on a bit but besides that it was a very great sushi place.
author: Di Andra E.

description:
ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI FOR $27!!!
A great menu with dozens of sushi and sashimi selections.  
Just off the corner of Columbus and Powell in SFO.. 
A great neighborhood Sushi joint. A must see in San Francisco
author: Michael T.

description: A pretty good AYCE if i do say so myself, they have several cooked roll options which is why this is one of my favorite spots, even tho there is some rolls that are more fresh than others. I love the small restaurant atmosphere and the decor. Definitely recommended to big parties and new sushi eaters!
author: Meghan V.

description:
Really truly horrible joint in a beautiful location. The quality of food is horrible, fish is anything but fresh, obviously purchased cheaply from some dirty suppliers, but their prices are on the higher side. In the city where people are mostly no strangers to the  good stuff in any category this joint doesn't belong. All the good reviews are definitely written by their buddies and themselves, because not one item (and hungry we ordered almost all kinds from buffet menu) was even nearly not bad.
And the atmosphere there with old Tvs on with some sports like in the bar, no wonder there were only 3-4 other 'hunters' in a prime time on Saturday. Customers vote with no-shows. Not even a touch of true Japanese cuisine and style. Totally gross. So was the service - like the third world - in the middle of SF!u Totally gross!。
author: Jonnie W.

description: They say it's all you can eat but they provide horrible service. We had to ask four times for our drinks and twice for plates and shot glasses for sake.  The food was ok. They give you a separate menu for all you can eat.  And now we have spent more than 20 minutes trying to sort the bill out.   All you can eat is not worth it.  There are plenty of places in the city with good service and good sushi. The waitresses are not helpful at all.  Totally unimpressed with the service here
author: Rosey S.

description: Pretty average sushi. The tuna was good. The salmon was not fresh, and looked like it had been cut/torn with a plastic utensil rather than a sushi knife.
author: David T.

description:
Sushi rolls were not good. Very disappointed in the quality. The crab meat had black pepper mixed in, which gave it an unusual taste. 

The only thing I enjoyed was the uni spoon and uni sushi.
author: Claire W.

description: I can't said how bad was the sushi , it taste the the sushi u eat in the buffet , and the food came out hella slow
author: Jason L.

description: This place puts so much rice and such a miniscule amount of fish on their sushi rolls. The food was average at best. Not worth the money that you pay. The service was quite poor too. I was embarrassed to take my friends there for dinner. I'm not going back there at all, and I'm spreading the word to avoid the place, since my son lives 2 blocks away now.
author: Ricardo M.

description: Came here because I heard it was good, basic sushi. We got the all you can eat. Ordered 2 soups; one came shortly after, the other came halfway through the meal. Ordered a few sushi rolls and one of the rolls was missing half its adervtised ingredients. Asked for it to be replaced, which they did and brought out a wrong order along with it. Our Tempura starter also did not arrive till the end of the meal. Food quality- worst sushi I've ever had. Seaweed was stale, the roll was all rice, did not taste fresh and we only ate half of what we ordered. It was definitely basic and barely edible. We asked for the bill and they have an automatic charge of 18% grat. Don't know how you can justify that when you bring out wrong orders, starters at different points of the meal, and the food is barely edible. Would only recommend to people I hate LOL
author: Willy R.

description: Made reservations for dinner sushi buffet.  Made to order . Menu had a great array of sushi rolls.  Waitress was on point and was very attentive.  Great San Francisco vibe!  Definitely go again!
author: Marie V.

description:
Turns out their all you can eat is not also all you can drink (beer that is)...whoops! But the drinking was necessary. The sushi was pretty weak on the AYCE menu. Heavily rice.

Fun place regardless!
author: Kelly G.

description: I don't know why everyone is hating on this place. Maybe if you guys weren't entitled SF jerks your expectations of this gem of a restaurant wouldn't be so high.  Most of you complain about the AYCE menu.  It's all you can eat guys.  You can't run this place into the ground.  Go drink some sake eat a bunch a sushi and be glad you got a decent deal.  You're the reason why these places close.  This place is wonderful.  Service is always good. The fish is fresh. It's a nice quiet cozy place.  And you jerks keep slamming on it for no reason.  It's a wonderful place and I recommend it to anyone.  Keep up the great work!
author: James L.

description: Worst sushi restaurant ever!!the server additude sucked! pluse the restaurant charges you 5 bucks tip! The sushi wasn't even that good! Never coming here ever
author: Andy C.

description:
Used to come here before. Now their nigiri is awful-- the rice is too densely packed and mushy and the quality of the fish has gone down. 

I got intense food poisoning... like really really intense food poisoning. Sushi hunter may have been good in the past but it's absolutely awful now. Please, please stay away for the sake of your bowels. I had to get off the BART on my way home to use the bathroom.
author: Sharon S.

description:
Come here if like:
Receiving no service
Fighting with cheap owner
Bad, low-quality sushi with most of them unavailable
Waiting over half an hour for food

Biggest mistake of my life coming here. This has got to be the worst restaurant I have been to in my entire life in terms of service and food. I ordered the all you eat sushi. Service is nonexistent and the waiters never check up on you. When you do get to order, half of the order is missing because they are apparently "unavailable." The orders are never fulfilled so make sure to order more than once if you make the mistake of eating here. When the owner feels like you ordered enough, she will tell you stop ordering. This owner is an epitome of the cheap Asian stereotype. Why have an all you can eat menu if you're going to have a nervous breakdown every time we force you to take our order? I thought it was funny how the owner took all the menus and left us with just one for 5 people to share every time we asked for more menus from other servers. The sushi was abysmal. The sushi was drier than beef jerky and rice was horribly old. I expected some decent sushi as SF is literally next to the ocean but didn't expect too high of a quality as it was an all you can eat place. Boy, I was wrong! There are so many cheaper and better sushi places. Save the stress and go somewhere else. Oh, 18% gratuity added for the stress, not service, they give you!
author: Daniel C.

description: Even for all you can eat sushi, quality of the meats were lackluster. Despite the written rules of the meal, I was not inquired about the discount for cash payment, nor was the discount actually given. The 18% gratuity did however end up making it onto the bill, and the receipt suggests yet another compounding gratuity on top. Why the restaurant runs into simple logistical issues I've not the slightest, but their mission statement seems a forlorn and faraway goal.
author: Charles J.

description:
I went into this place, after seeing that it said they had the best All You Can Eat options. One word describes them perfectly: TERRIBLE!! First of all, Sushi Hunter, being an AYCE option restaurant, I didn't expect them to have good quality fish; This time I just cared about the quantity of the food. But what I got was not even half of the food that I have ordered, and rude remarks from the manager/owner (old Asian woman, I don't know her name). 

So my friends and I ordered from a younger looking server. After over 30 minutes of wait (we actually timed them), the food still hasn't arrived. So we tried calling the server who came after like another 15 minutes, and asked where our food was. And after checking with the kitchen staff, she said we didn't order anything else. When we told her who we ordered from, she told us we were being rude and that we can just order from her right now, so despite her rude attitude towards her customers, we ordered more food (we paid around 40 dollars each, so might as well get as much as we can). However, of the many things we ordered, what we received was not even half of our order. When we called her over to ask her if the other half of our missing order was on its way out after waiting 20 minutes, she told us, it was not available, which would not have been a big deal, except for the fact that she refused to let us know when we ordered those things (we ordered the unavailable items 2 different times, thinking the order just didn't go through, only to find that we were never told that they were unavailable so we ended up waiting so long for food that wasn't even available!). When we told her that we were waiting so long for items that were unavailable because we were never informed that they were not there, she told us it was not her fault and that we need to stop complaining because she was working the best she can (So rude! she was yelling at her customers paying for service and telling us to stop complaining!)

Finally, we just let it go and ordered a few more different things from the menu and again, the wait time was incredibly long. When we got the order, the rice was so hard and tasted as if it was stale and old! wow.. I don't get why some other people posted that fish were fresh. Fresh fish, clams, and other seafoods don't stink. They obviously didn't try FRESH food. 

Customers complain when they feel that what they got was not their money's worth. That is exactly how I felt yesterday. This is my FIRST time posting on Yelp, just warning the readers what to expect if they might even think about going to this place.

SUCH LOW QUALITY FOOD AND SERVICE! DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY HERE IT IS NOT WORTH IT! 

I am never coming back here.
author: Ho Jae K.

description: Horrible service . Add on 18% automatically to AYCE . Wouldn't recommend at all . Waited 15 to be sat . It's small so not a lot of people either .
author: Maine G.

description: I got food poisoning from the sushi nigiri, terrible next 12 hours for me. Would not recommend...
author: Kira S.

description: This place is awesome! The a la carte menu for the all you can eat bit has everything you'd expect, the sushi tastes great, the service is great. The price was pretty reasonable for what we got. The music was not loud at all, which, unless you're a big fan of mediocre music from the nineties is not a bad thing. Really, this place is awesome. We told the chef to just keep something interesting coming and we were not disappointed. It gets kinda busy, so you might want to reserve a table if you're going with a bunch of people.
author: aaron n.

description: Christy assisted us with a perfect evening recently. My parents were in town for my mom's birthday, and the staff here made it very fun for us.. they taught her how to properly drink her first sake bomb! The crunch rolls are delicious and so are the garlic edamame. The gyoza is also really good, especially during happy hour prices. Beautiful part of the city, and easy to walk by without noticing. Definitely worth stopping by.
author: Brandon S.

description:
This place grew on me.

Walking in, it looks and smells like a mid-market Vegas casino. The menu didn't help. Most dishes are spicy or fried. Those are usually red-flags for sushi that is substandard in attempts to cover it up with oil-boiling or veggie heat. 

Then I sat down. The service was absolutely on-point. The staff moves with purpose and is very attentive (while not obtrusive). I felt like I was back in Japan again where one's own self-worth is at least partly tied to how you treat other people. The edamame was perfect and *might* have even been steamed not microwaved. The seaweed salad could have ended the evening - the material itself was fine, it was just doused in substandard sauce - until the roll arrived.

There began my re-evaluation.

The rice of the roll was was well-steamed and sticky. The fish tasted fresh and firm. Everything's was on-point again except...it was too spicy. Like not even a little bit too spicy...but a lot.

That's when I realized they might not be frying or spicing things to cover up the taste, but because they think San Franciscans want their sushi that way.

Look San Franciscans have lots of foibles - we're overly feely, poor social experimenters, etc - but we know food. We're not afraid of sushi. It doesn't need to be spicy or fried. We just want fresh, quality ingredients.

So I'm gonna give Sushi Hunter a 4-star, not for what it is, but for what it could be. To be fair, without the promise of change, I was gonna give it a 3.4 anyway which *almost* rounds up. This place is right on that tipping point. If they stopped making spicy/fried food and just started making fresh sushi - with the skills and material they clearly already possess - they could be one of the better sushi joints in the city.

An upgrade to the interior wouldn't hurt, but again, I hold out hope.

Worth a visit to form your own conflicted opinion.
author: Christopher M.

description:
I had my doubts walking into this place due to the low reviews. I should have went with my gut. I'm a big believer that sushi rice is super important to sushi. Theirs was soggy: they type that sticks to your teeth. I ordered a spicy scallop and Philadelphia roll. The salmon texture was off and not fresh. TMI but the food didn't sit well with me that night. 

If you're forced to come here, order the udon. I didn't taste it, but my friends said it wasn't bad. If you can avoid it, do.
author: Emily H.

description:
Never going to Sushi Hunter again.  Sorry...

- Slowww service.  Took forever to get food on the table and into my belly.
- Fish did not taste that great or fresh.  Rice also tasted weird and had a really mushy consistency.  Yuck.  My friends and I were scared we'd get sick from the food later on.  Sushi was not enjoyable. :(
- AYCE sushi price isn't worth it...
- Menu options are kind of limited too...
- It's also difficult finding parking nearby the restaurant.

Sad face. :(
author: Francesca L.

description:
Stopped in after getting lost my first night in San Fran. Ordered a Teriyaki Salmon w miso soup and rice. The service was great-the waitress was very kind and understanding when I explained to her I never used chopsticks before, so she brought me out a fork. Food was out quickly after ordering.

The salmon was fantastic. Perfect amount of teriyaki and cooked just the way I liked it. This was my first time trying miso soup- it was good, I can see myself ordering it again. 

I would definitely check this place out if I in San Fran again. A solid 7.5-8/10
author: Steve B.

description: Service was excellent. Place was nice however the sushi was not there. It crumbled in my hand which was weird. Taste was not the best. They do have a all you can eat buffet for $30 per person. Selection in the buffet menu was not the best either.
author: Ibelig V.

description:
I gave this place two tries, I won't give them a third!!!

First time I followed the sign in front that said their special was house made ramen...however when I sat down they pulled the old bait and switch said they were too busy to sell me ramen and offered me udon, I fell for it and took the udon

Second time I asked before I sat down if they had ramen, the waitress said yes, I sat down , ordered a Sapporo and ramen, "sorry no ramen only udon" seriously!  Fooled me once shame on you, fool me twice, ain't going to be no second time!  I left and won't be back!
author: william b.

description:
Any All You Can Eat sushi place makes me semi-hesitant. My friends visiting from out of town were persistent about finding an AYCE sushi place, so we decided on Sushi Hunter. I called at 6pm on the 30th and made a reservation for 6:30pm, the girl on the phone was very nice. I showed up around 6:20pm and was seated promptly. It was not super busy which was nice. The environment is OK, the walls are painted bright blue which is a somewhat bright color for  dinner ambience. The place is small, so I imagine the brighter color helps the room feel bigger. 

The service is mostly why I'm rating 5 stars (but don't get me wrong, the food was great too). I've worked in the service industry in the past for many years, so I am very critical of my dining experiences. I didn't catch the name of our server, but she was extremely attentive, knew the menu well, helped me with a recommendation, and made sure we had everything we needed. Any extra plates, dishes, napkins that were taking up space were removed in a timely manner. 

My date and I ordered off the a la cart menu and our dishes came out very quick - we took part in the happy hour and ordered 2 alaska rolls ($6 each) and 1 spicy tuna roll($6), and then ordered the specialty Lion king roll. The Lion King roll ($15 was charged, though I thought the menu said $14) differs from place to place and I have to say their Lion King is my favorite of all the other sushi restaurants I've been too. I really enjoyed the Chicken Karrage happy hour appetizer ($4) which was extremely delicious (the batter was nice and crispy and the meat was very tender), a miso soup($1 Honestly not my favorite miso soup, but very delicious) and the Wakame Salad($3 I LOVED the salad, though its pretty much the same everywhere) as well. We spent $53 including 2 hot teas. 

Our other 2 friends ordered the all you can eat - one vegan/vegetarian and one with meat. I talked to them yesterday and they still feel full :P The AYCE takes longer when you order alot of things, so they recommend ordering only 5 things at a time. It did take their dishes much longer for ours to come out, but their dishes always featured alot of items. 

If this place was more convenient to get to, I would make a point to come here more often. When I am in the area craving sushi, Sushi Hunter will be the top of my list. Thank you Sushi Hunter for a great dinner! :)
author: Courtney T.

description:
Despite waiting for awhile in between the orders of AYCE, I love this place! I think this is the only AYCE in SF! The sushi isn't extremely fresh but for a cheap price, it can't get any better than this!!! The seaweed salad was a little too sweet but it's ok. Chicken teriyaki was right portion for me. Fried tofu was a little soggy but still not bad. Potstickers were damn good and I loved most of the ngiri especially the salmon! I think the salmon was the freshest fish there. 

Restaurant is like another hole in the wall but not small at all. Just the right amount of space. Lightings were cute.. balance of light and dark. Soy sauce teapot holder was suppperrr cute hehe :) Staff welcomes you right when you come in and waiters are attentive as much as they can. Anyways, if your not too picky about your sushi and have a little more patience, then affordable AYCE is the spot!!! AYCE on the weekdays, if you pay cash is $25 per person. If you pay credit then it's $27/person. There's an extended ayce menu but the $25 is good enough. I will mos def come back... yay!!!
author: Sharmaine M.

description:
My bro-in-law and his friends get together once a month for dinner and drinks as an opportunity for the guys to hang out and get loose.  He kindly invited me for this trip and the venue chosen was sushi hunter in North Beach.  They're known for their AYCE sushi, and as a fan of the Socal AYCE dining, I was definitely game.  It would be along night of disappointing food.

There was quite a few options to choose from but they were basically the same thing.  The rolls were all pathetically tiny and portions were so small that we had to order things multiple times to get more than just a taste, extending the already long wait times.  Everything that came out seemed really half-assed and I wasn't even remotely impressed with the food.

Service was sllllooooooooowwww and our waitress didn't know what she was serving as she attempted to describe the different rolls and sushi, and pronounced everything wrong to boot.  For what you get, their $28 AYCE option is pretty expensive.  Combined with the all-you-can-drink option, $40 is through the roof considering the lack of choices and restriction to sake.  I was really disappointed with the meal here, and kind of sadly, left hungry.  Never again.

Food: 4/10

Service: 4/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 5/10
author: Joe M.

description: The staff was really nice and the sushi was delicious. We had the all you can eat sushi for 30 dollars a person but we were charged an additional 20 percent gratuity for a table of 3 which we have never heard of before. Would've rated 5 stars but disappointed on the gratuity charge.
author: Irving R.

description:
This place gets 5 stars for being the only AYCE I can find in SF, but I'm not a huge fan of ordering from a waitress instead of ordering from the chef, even when I'm sitting at the bar.

Came here on vacation with my fiance. The food was AMAZING. While the AYCE selection isn't super varied, the quality of the fish is tops! AYCE also includes some really yummy non-sushi appetizers that differ from just edamame. I was surprised to see croquettes! The chefs here are quite generous with their cuts. They don't try to "over-rice" you or cut fish too thin. The nigiri here was cut thicker than at any other place I've been to. We loved it.

We came near closing, so the service wasn't the best. The waitresses got a couple of things mixed up and took a little longer than usual. However, they were fairly packed, so I understand. I highly recommend the Hot Angel Roll, ANY nigiri, gyoza, and croquettes! I got to try my first croquette here, and it was soooooo yummy.

I would definitely come back again!
author: Jaimie C.

description:
Not recommended!! Not all sushi joints are created equal. 
Visiting San Francisco for my birthday. Just wanted a descent night out in a new city I've never been to. Did a random search and landed here. Bad idea. Wish it could of been a beginner luck sort of thing. 
Walked in with my girlfriend and was pleasantly surprised with the modern decor. Wasn't greeted for a minute. Finally someone pointed us to a table. POINTED!!! Who does that? 
Waited 5-6 minutes before being served water. We ordered the all you can eat right away. It took almost 25 minutes before anything was brought out. Three items were missed. The sushi was something you could get out of a grocery store. Sorry, the truth hurts. Hope this makes them do things better. Go somewhere and save the 70 bucks we wasted
author: Tish D.

description:
Every time I've been here I've ordered the all-you-can-eat sushi (for lunch, late lunch, dinner, late dinner...multiple times) It's a fantastic price for endless sushi. That's the only reason I'm giving 3 stars.

It's a perfect place if you want to leave with a food baby of sushi and soup. The rolls are super unbalanced with an excessive amount of rice. They'll charge you for the rolls if you leave any pieces left over (they don't offer take-out for the all-you-can-eat menu).

The service is a hit or miss as well. I've had to flag my waitress down after patiently waiting each time for a new order, water/tea, or the check/to pay the check when the place was practically empty.

Good all-you-can-eat, but lacking in rice/fish ratio and service.
author: Hannah F.

description: This place was eh. The decor is pretty cute and modern looking. Its all blue and white. Even the Christmas tree. They went all out on color coordinating for sure. The waitresses were nice and the food came out pretty quickly. We had a large group there on a Saturday evening and it was completely empty except for our group. We all ordered all you can eat for $28 each. Downside is if you want all you can eat the whole table has to do it too (i.e. no half a La carte and half all you can eat at the same table). There weren't that many rolls on the menu. The actual rolls were kind of bland. They weren't super amazing or super disgusting. It was just eh. Lol. So I probably wouldn't come here again for all you can eat since it is pretty pricy for mediocre sushi. The miso soup was good though.
author: Amy T.

description:
My new years resolution is to go to the gym more often. 

This will coincide perfectly with my re-discovery of Sushi Hunter's All-You-Can-Eat dinner option. (the all you can drink Sake option is almost as evil).

It's simple, its filling, they don't over do it on the rice like some AYCE places and they are really fast with the appetizers. (rolls take a little longer, but that's expected with the volume they are churning out).

If you are partying in North Beach, or need a break during an all day event (SantaCon, Holiday Pub Crawl, Halloween on Saturday in 2015), this is DEFINITELY the place to go with a group.

Just make sure everyone wants AYCE. they were cool with our DD not doing it at a table of 4 but it was a slower night. the rule is, everyone "eat's all they can" or no-one does.  I truly appreciated their slight flexibility on this.  Usually that's not the case (and completely understandable given the business model)
author: Mike V.

description:
3 Stars is pushing the rating. 2 1/2
The place was 1/2 empty on a Saturday. The place was very noisy. There crowd (8-10) at one table made up most of the noise. The Music from the sound system mad up the rest of the noise.  The service was OK but NOT great. The Sushi was OK but not great. The Ice Tea was marginal (3.50). I had to ask for pickled Ginger.
This was a All you can eat for $30.00. (But there are limits in the fine print)
The total tab came out about $43.00 They added an 18% gratuity? I did get a recipe.
I did leave full, but this is not a Re-Do
author: Ed S.

description:
I'll start with the positives.
The quality of the sushi was not terrible.
Apologetic staff

Now with the negatives.
Once seated, waited over 30 min to get less then 10 pieces of nigiri. Waited another 15 min for the second round. One staff member said she was sorry about the service because one reason or another...so she offered us dessert. I thought, "well that was nice of her."
So then the bill came, she charged us for the dessert and included gratuity for a party of four. 
Questionable business ethic. Considered your other alternatives for sushi.
author: Brandon D.

description:
I am writing an updated review now, because our last trip to Sushi Hunter was a seriously mixed experience. The food itself was as good as you can hope for AYCE, fresh fish but so WAY too much rice in the rolls. My biggest issue here was that the service was very dishonest. They were very friendly and accommodating for a large group, but it was so shady I dont think I will go back. 

1. We arrived at 8pm for an 8pm reservation that they confirmed 2 days before. People were just obviously taking extra time that were sitting in our section so they then tried to tell us our reservation wasn't until 8:30. If they had just been honest and mentioned the reason we couldn't be seated it wouldn't have been a big deal. 

2. They essentially didn't bring us over half the food we asked for. Then tried to get us to order more. We re-ordered some of the rolls and they just never came and they said that was everything. 

3. The worst part was the check. We were splitting it between everyone, and gratuity was included. We had decided to tip an extra $4 a person because regardless of the inconsistencies, they had been really friendly. Most people paid with cash, but there were a few cards. They charged each card an extra $13 per person, and said that was all the cash they had. This was just absolutely incorrect. It was too late in the night, and we really didnt have the time to fight with her when she had already put the cash away so we had to just leave it at that. 

It was a pretty disappointing trip after really enjoying visiting there previously.
author: Lily C.

description:
The all you can eat is the biggest scam I have ever come across. 
They make rolls with 99%rice and then expect you to eat it all or you get an extra charge. They will automatically add 18% tip for all you can eat! 
Service is horrible the servers all have an attitude and never come around unless you go get them. 
I would give this place a -10 if I could!!!!
It's horrible and I don't understand how they stay in business in SF!!!! 
I wouldn't ever send my worse enemy there!!!!!
author: Micaela L.

description:
Randomly dropped in since a friend craved sushi and saw one on our walk. Was reluctant at first seeing it is only 3 stars on yelp. That's pretty bad for sushi in SF. 

Well let's just say yelp didn't lie. It was at most 3 star. The sashimi was frozen tasting, the crunchy roll wasn't very crunchy. Good thing it was only a snack stop. But my own fault for going into a three star place for sushi in SF.
author: Lilly W.

description: I would have rather been brought my menus promptly then stabbed in my eyes that had to wait the unbearable 45 minutes for the menus to come. Currently my lower intestine is testing my sphincter's capability to hold back the gush of feces from flowing out of my body like a crack spraying through the Hoover Dam. There is a cosmic ship to my no atypical fecal flow. I would recommend this for anyone who hasn't pooped in months, or wants a tape-worm like experience.
author: Jordan B.

description:
Just Don't...
Le sigh, despite the reviews my BF and I decided to give Sushi Hunter a fair try. We walk in at 7:30pm, we're warmly greeted and sat in the very empty restaurant (5 tables and 2 of them are closing out) Andddddd no one comes back...ever. The server is doing a mix of walking in circles and nothing. After 17 mins of the Warriors game we snapped to our senses
and decided to abort this mission. Lame...we really wanted to like this spot but the reviews were absolutely right. They just don't have it together
author: Jovone W.

description:
For AYCE, I can't complain.  That said, the hot food left a lot to be desired and the rolls were just okay.  I don't need a lot of sashimi or nigiri so I can't comment on the freshness of the fish aside from the philly roll I had, which was fine but nothing to write home about.  My friends on the other hand tried nearly ever nigiri on the menu and were satisfied overall.  Service was good and food came out promptly.  

Udon:  4 out of 5 stars.  Good broth.

Mixed tempura:  2 out of 5 stars.  The shrimp tempura tasted powdery, and I don't understand why that would be.  Perhaps the shrimp was frozen or old?  The batter was a little soggy.  

Agadashi tofu: 3 out of 5 stars.  COLD and the broth lacked any flavor

Chicken teriyaki:  3 out of 5 stars.  Overly salty -- both the chicken and the sauce.  

Philly roll:  4 out of 5 stars.  Hard to mess this up.

Inari:  4 out of 5 stars.
author: L C.

description: Not sure why only 3 stars because the service was great. Fish was fresh. Staff was welcome and very accommodating to dietary restrictions. Would definitely comeback.
author: Vienna M.

description: Great sushi and sushi bar service! Got everything we asked for. Very accommodating to special orders. Food came quickly and refilled beverages without asking. Nice staff and clean bathrooms. Highly recommended.
author: Natalie L.

description:
Came here with a large group, where half of us ordered a la carte, and the other half did all you can eat.

I did a la carte, and only ordered some avocado cucumber rolls with seaweed salad, which are pretty hard to mess up, so they were okay.

The other half that did all you can eat were unsatisfied.  The fish definitely didn't look very fresh, and were definitely poor cuts.  They also served the plates extremely slowly and always with less than what was ordered.  After lingering for over 2 hours with an extremely slow rate of food serving, they said to us they were all out of salmon and all the other fish we were ordering, so we just decided to end the night and leave.

I don't really blame a restaurant for trying to save money, but they shouldn't do all you can eat if they're just going to do cheap tricks to not serve you what you paid for.  They should just not have an all you can eat option and be more upfront to their customers.
author: Matt T.

description: My family of 4 went to this restaurant on a whim because we were visiting San Francisco for the day and my son wanted to go to an All You Can Eat sushi restaurant. I searched online and this was the only restaurant to pop up for All You Can Eat. At $30 per person, it was extremely worth it. My daughter was free because she was 2 years old; yippeee!! The food here was the freshest and most delicious that I have ever eaten. The sashimi basically melted once it touched our tongues. My hubby said, this is where we will be going to, everytime we want sushi, even if it is over 2 hours drive. The restaurant is a bit loud because of the music, the wait times is a bit long because of the many customers, and the place is semi cramped because of the lack of space in San Francisco but the food more than makes up for everything.
author: Faye Y.

description:
I always have a good time at AYCE sushi places because, hey, lump sum + sushi forever = good times in my tummy. But I'll preface this by saying I've been completely and utterly spoiled by Toronto and its mecca of AYCE sushi places that defies logic, both in terms of price (soooo cheap), quality (soooo good) and quantity (this menu is how many pages long and they're ALL included in the deal?)

Aaaanyway, Sushi Hunter is a decent offering for a city with very few AYCE sushi restaurants. The service was super friendly--they actually asked us to move mid-way through our meal to accommodate a large incoming party, and gave us plenty of plum wine on the house to compensate. The decor is pretty minimal and a tad tacky in terms of lighting, but spacious enough that you could easily have a big group and not want for space. 

The food? Here are my thoughts:

Alaska Roll - Rice could have been better and salmon was a bit...soft....but overall satisfying.

Philly Roll - Not too much cream cheese. That's a good thing.

Rock 'n' Roll Roll - My friend's choice. It wasn't bad, but eel does very little to excite me.

Wild Fire Roll - Spicy salmon and cucumber. Such simple things bring such great pleasure.

Hamachi and Salmon Maki - My two favorite fish in an AYCE setting. Yeah, we ordered a lot of this.

Wakame - LOVED! Chewy and perfectly marinated. My friend hadn't had a lot of wakame before and she actually asked if we could order more. Why yes, hon, I believe we can on account of this is an AYCE place!

Chicken Karaage - Is there any food the Japanese don't do well? Fried chicken is manna from heaven. Period. This was pretty good. Not super oily with tender meat.

It's best to come here with a large group (e.g. friends' night out, birthday party, etc.) and just order everything on the menu that catches your fancy. Sushi is obviously very shareable, but most of the other menu items are too, so it's a great "family dinner"-style place.
author: Josephine L.

description: A very mediocre sushi restaurant. The AYCE (all you can eat) option seems like a great deal but they put very little fish in their rolls for this deal and it only includes the most basic rolls and kitchen items, speciality rolls are a separate cost. Furthermore, they automatically add 18% gratuity to the bill because they know that they wouldn't get tipped since the service is so crappy. They watch you trying to stare them down and continue to talk to each other and laugh behind the counter until you finally go up and talk to them to order more. I believe they do this so the food settles and you get fuller off less food and they save money but they add the gratuity to the bill so they can get away with this without losing their tip. Only once in the hour and a half that I was there did they come back to refill my water and ask how I was doing and this was at the very end of my time there. Poor service aside, the fish is subpar and it's comparable to the premise sushi you can buy at Safeway. I would never recommend this place to someone and will never be going here again.
author: Austin S.

description:
The food was decent, service was awful and all you can eat was $30 (27 mon-th, 30 fri-sun) It wasnt that busy when we first got there but they moved us to a different table after we were here for 5 minutes and it was ridiculously hard to get their attention the whole time. They also only gave us half the stuff we ordered and when we noticed that everyone else that came after us already got their food, we asked them and they said they forgot the other half so we didn't receive it for 30 minutes.

They need at least one or two more people working here. They stopped another customer while they were talking to go pick up the phone. After waiting 7-8 min after getting our check, we just walked up to pay because no one ever looked over or came to pick it up. Their chicken katsu and seaweed salad were pretty much the only things I liked. I would definitely not recommend this place.
author: Judy K.

description:
Pretty good sushi, but nothing ground breaking. I typically go with the 49er roll and the Titanic, and they are consistent and good, but not amazing. The chicken katsu is OK, not amazing, but consistent in flavor and portion size.  I've never had anything here that knocks my socks off, but each time I order food I feel satisfied. I don't eat on site typically, so I'm not sure about service, but their TOGO service is prompt and ready when they say it will be. It's also really pricey for what you get.  

Weird thing is they were closed for almost two months for "remodeling" but when I returned to the restaurant when it reopened, I noticed nothing different about the place. 

Overall recommendation is, if you're in the mood for sushi in North Beach, go for it, but but be prepared to pay a lot for OK sushi.
author: Meredith A.

description: Most terrible food quality and service. You can get better sushi from a supermarket and not pay the 18% gratitude forced on your bill
author: Annie W.

description: Had the worst possible experience here. The waitress and employees made me feel very uncomfortable. I ordered the all you can eat for $27. There was a little fallout of rice left from the sushi and the waitress told us we had to finish ALL the rice or else we would be charged extra. Not only that, each nigiri sushi had a HUGE proportion of rice compared to the fish. At the end of the meal, we were charged 18% gratuity without our consent and with only a party of 2 people.
author: Kristianna C.

description: food was good but wish they had better selections on their AYCE menu. Also they include a 18% tip already on your check and it doesn't matter the size party. Didn't like that at all! Otherwise place looks nice and service was okay.
author: Ana M.

description:
I recently moved to SF and was excited to try sushi here, as everyone told me it was very good in the Bay.  Well, after about three duds, I found this awesome restaurant!  

*I should also note that finding AYCE sushi in the city is hard to come by.* 

Continuing on, my friend and I made a reservation on a thursday night.  We were greeted warmly and seated right away. The decor is just okay and I don't think the theme fits with the type of establishment it is (especially with the plasma screen tvs).  Nonetheless, I didn't come to this restaurant for its looks.  I came to eat!

The AYCE menu selection was quite impressive and ranged from udon, tempura, to an army of different types of sushi.  The quality was fresh and I am so very happy that when I ordered spicy tuna roll, I actually got fresh, soft, and tasty ahi tuna.  The last couple of places I have been to have given me dried out tuna, or even this one time, I received tuna from a can mixed with Sriracha!  The ratio of rice to fish was solid.  The gyoza were just okay, but that's a small price to pay for such yummy sushi!  

The staff was really friendly, AYCE was legit, and the price was right.  I will definitely be coming back here again!
author: Josh S.

description: Just want to start off saying, don't waste your money on this overpriced food. Manager is super rude and when we politely said we didn't like the food, she would yell and not accommodate with us at first. Not a place you would ever want dinner
author: Sandra B.

description:
Just left here with my best friend. All you can eat deal is AMAZING. The staff is friendly and fun even ... when they are super busy. The manager Michelle, the manager, is amazing!! She walks around, hangs with the tables and sets the environment. 

Overall. The sushi was fresh and delicious and the vibes here were young and fun! Definitely recommend  for a fun Friday girls night or even a date night.
author: Shannen B.

description: The waitress made one of my friends move tables because he was the only one not eating all you can eat sushi, despite our table being in clear view of the waitress and sushi chefs. She also charged us the 18% gratuity rate even though one of our friends was not eating. The sushi was extremely bland, and the fried sushi was not crispy at all. All the sushi was soggy and had poor taste. Will never come here again.
author: Zach M.

description:
Service was RIDICULOUSLY slow. Waitresses completely clueless about your needs. My friends were already sitting when I joined them, and though the entire waitstaff saw me enter and sit down (as the restaurant was practically empty), I still had to wave a waitress over a few minutes afterwards because no one came over. We were ready to order, we needed drinks, etc. Had to ask for water twice. Then waited FOREVER for food to come out. We did the AYCE and they never came back to check on us to see if we wanted more food unless we were flagging them down. They would clear plates, but they wouldn't ask if we wanted more food! They weren't even very busy. They would just stand around the kitchen/register chatting with each other.

The food itself tasted pretty good, I have no problems with that, just the awful service. AND very disappointed to see an automatic 18% gratuity charge for the AYCE. No wonder their service was shitty, because they know they'll get tipped regardless.
author: Jess S.

description: Went for the first time tonight and had a great dinner! All of the servers were incredibly nice and helpful, never making us feel rushed even though we took forever to decide what to get from the AYCE menu at first! The food felt like it was consistently made with care, and everything was served hot and fresh (well, at least the warm items!). I really enjoyed the sushi - I've been to other AYCE sushi places where they attempt to disguise lower quality fish, etc. by dousing rolls in strong sauces - thankfully, that's not the case here. I also really appreciate the variety of non-sushi appetizers on the menu, because as much as I enjoy sushi, I love being able to choose from a range of other Japanese treats. I had a really lovely evening here, and will definitely be back!
author: Delia Z.

description:
Sushi hunter is a decent option for cheap sushi in north beach. There is an all you can eat option and nothing here is inedible. You won't find a better price than here. As you can probably expect this isn't going to be the finest quality sushi but it is good. 

I usually still to simple rolls and those are pretty good here. I never spend more that 20 or 30 dollars for a full meal which is unheard of when it comes to sushi in SF. I also really love the setup in the place. It feels like a club as it is usually dark in the place with neon lighting. There is also usually new club music being played over the loud speakers as well. The drinks are good and usually you are able to get your food in a short amount of time. 

If you don't need the frills in your sushi outing and just want a large of amount of sushi at a good price then this is the place to try. It isn't something you are going to want to go to everyday or take an important date to but if you are craving sushi you could do worse.
author: Nick R.

description: AYCE sushi with fresh sushi for $30 and unlimited hot sake for $13. Great deal, great service. Will definitely be back.
author: Maddie F.

description: Decent sushi place. They have an AYCE menu but like any AYCE it isn't as appealing as it sounds. They have an uni spoon is really good though. Everything else is just average. If you are looking for a quick spot to just get some sushi and you happen to be in the area then it is a good place. The atmosphere is fun and the wait staff are very nice but I think the quality of sushi they have is lacking due to the quantity of sushi that they have. The sushi on their special board are actually the really good stuff. The rolls on the menu.. Not so much.  Another good thing is that they have the games on when we go. Always a plus when we can stay connected to our teams.
author: Fanny C.

description: Worst food in my life. I never posted on Yelp. But this restaurant made me to post a review. PLEASE SAVE THE MONEY FOR SOMETHING ELSE instead!!!!!!!
author: Jane P.

description:
Seriously, save your money and DO NOT do the AYCE sushi. Soooooo not worth the $25 for Mon-Th and most certainly not the $28 for Fri-Sun. The rolls are basic and filled with mushy rice and topped with warm fish. 

It would be more with your while to go elsewhere and buy 2 better quality specialty rolls. I was so sad leaving with an unsatisfying experience. The search for a good AYCE sushi in SF continues I suppose. 

I will say though the staff was nice and friendly. The only reason I think it deserves any stars at all.
author: Ali S.

description:
I unfortunately have time to write this review because they lost our order. First, I asked for water with no ice, and 2 minutes later was brought water with 4 hue ice cubes in it. We ordered all you can eat soon after sitting down and received the first plate (about 20 minutes ago). Since then, we've been waiting for lots more sushi. Mind you, I'm only with ONE other person and there's still open seating in the restaurant. We never got checked on.. So after we grabbed the attention of another waiter we wanted to verify that the rest of our food was coming, especially since the table next to us got here after us and got a HUGE platter of sushi before the rest of ours came out. The waitress checked with the chefs, came back, and asked us to re-order. Considering they marked all the food onto one sheet of paper, I'm not sure how half of our order got lost. The sushi is good (not great.. Rice not tightly rolled, also we're in the Bay so it better be good) but the service detracts from any desire to come back here. We were hesitant to come because we saw the low star rating, but decided to come anyway for AYCE. Will not be coming back. 

Tl;dr: really poor service outweighs the good but not great food.
author: Jenny L.

description:
It's the only sushi place in SF that does AYCE so by default I must love them. The quality is decent. The fish is pretty fresh. The portion of the AYCE sushi rolls are pretty small which is good so you can have a variety of rolls. 

They recently updated their menu and charge extra for the sashimi, which is irritating. I highly disapprove. I don't think it's worth the extra price. 

The service is usually pretty good considering how busy they are. The staff is genuinely kind and approachable. 

The environment is super cute for a Japanese restaurant. It's clean with adorable booths!
author: Sa M.

description: AYCE? We were rudely cut off after 7 orders of nigiri. That was okay for us though because we started gagging as we forced ourselves to finish our meal. We were immediately turned off, but lucky for us some IPAs at an Irish Pub down the street helped keep the sushi down. We will definitely be spending the extra cash at non-AYCE place when we return to Frisco in the future.
author: Christopher O.

description:
3 friends made their way into the challenge of all you can eat sushi!  Sushi Hunter did not disappoint!  And while, if you are a sushi aficionado or snob, this might not be your first choice, i think this is one of the best AYCE places in town.  The menu was, unlike other places, full with tons of choices from appetizers to tempuras, teriyakis, nigiri and rolls, all included in the $28 (on weekends, $25 during the week) order.  The sushi, we were relieved to see, was not 90% rice with a hint of fish, it was the appropriate amount of rice to the fish portion, which admittedly was smaller than a piece by piece order, yet none-the-less tasty, fresh and well presented.  We ordered a little, ok, a lot from the above categories and ended our meal with mocha and green tea ice cream.  We loved the selection, the freshness of the fish, the flavor of the cooked items and the atmosphere.  

I left off the 5th star because we all felt the service was a bit lackluster.  The restaurant is served by Chinese women who did not exhibit a passion for their jobs but performed adequately anyway.  I asked about some additional options but if it's not on the menu don't bother, they were always "too busy" to accommodate and yet in spite of the above we had a delightful evening, good food, great value and we will be returning again to sample more of their delights.  You will not leave hungry or disappointed from the selection and the price was right too!  Hope this helps you make your way to this North Beach establishment the next time you need AYCE Sushi!
author: Irv S.

description:
I've eaten at Sushi Hunter with my family well over 20 times in the past several years. It has been our go to neighborhood sushi restaurant. We have consistently had positive experiences, however, tonight can only be described as a breakdown and complete failure in all aspects. 

Furthermore, the gratuity is automatically added to your bill without notice. It ends up being approximately $10 more per person. We left a tip without knowing the gratuity was included. This is not an 18% gratuity restaurant. The service was second rate as was the food. 

There were repeated times where they never brought us the right food or any food at all or the wrong food. The food we ordered never got to us while things we didn't order quickly came. We had to ask numerous amount of times for what we wanted!

What Sushi Hunter is doing is borderline fraudulent. If you want to walk out feeling ripped off this is the place for you. 

Beware of the Sushi Hunter. They are far more concerned with making a few extra dollars than keeping their loyal customers happy. Horrible dining experience.
author: Jim B.

description:
PERFECT NIGHT!
We had last minute company and they accommodated 6 people on a Saturday night. The waitress was superb from recommending amazing garlic edamame and butterfish rolls, to clapping us through our sushi bombs, to singing happy birthday bringing the birthday girl free ice cream! Thanks for making this our new favorite neighborhood sushi place!!!
author: Drew L.

description: Tried to upsell us on terrible sushi rolls. Rice didn't taste fresh, neither did the fish.
author: Satyajeet P.

description:
I have the sincerest appreciation for Sushi Hunter. This restaurant fulfills all of my personal sushi-needs, and as a human that can consume sushi like a high powered ocean vacuum, I have sizable needs. 

Sushi Hunter has excellent food and a full menu, stellar service and exceptional customer appreciation, and a space that lacks an ego and welcomes you with humility and cleanliness. 

Some things that will tickle your sushi-bone: 

Sashimi (Always good, but here's some gooder-ers):
 - Sake
 - Red snapper
 - Hamachi 
 - Albacore 

Nigiri: 
 - Saba (tastes like low tide in the best way possible). 
 - Sake Hara (tastes like butter). 

They have a nice selection of rolls, the one that stood out to me the most was the Crazy Horse. They also have a nice variety of sashimi/nigiri/bento box dinner combinations if you're feeling indecisive. 

My last dinner at Sushi Hunter was a lovely 2.5 hour endeavor. My friend and I kept the orders coming, but not for one second did the wait staff hint at us leaving. We felt comfortable taking our time, enjoying our meal, and ordering more at our leisure. Hot tea was always refilled, and the wait staff never overlooked our needs despite the busy hour and the sake-bombing riffraff at the table next to us. 

Overall, head over here for a lovely, casual, tasty sushi-sperience with great service.
author: Chelsea B.

description: Don't get the Bento box, it sucks & the chicken is horrible & rice is disgusting. Only saving grace was the Uni spoon.
author: Toby D.

description:
Chose the All you can eat Sushi. It' was just ok for me. Clams had sand in them. Spider Roll - Barely any crab. Just the legs... Nigri style fish was ok fresh. Weekday nights not as busy as weekends

Service was ok.
author: Thomas C.

description:
Sat down around 7:30, asked for ayce and were given menus. About 5min later, a female server whose name is Christy walks up and asks us if we are locals, we responded yes. She said that the website clearly states that ayce is 5-7 and she has to now serve us ayce because the previous server already started our meals from the ayce menu. She was extremely condescending and continued to tell us that we need to be here before 7 for ayce and she won't be so accommodating next time we come in. 

She interrupted our dinner to make us feel bad for her server messing up. If we had known that the ayce was limited to 5-7, we wouldn't have ordered from that menu. 

As for the food, I could have made better sushi at home and I don't cook. The sushi was rolled with very minimal, tasteless and old looking fish in the center. The first batch of nigri had old rice and the rest of the sushi's rice was wet and warm.

The service was also bad, our first server was very nice but Christy and the other male were rude. I kept getting bumped into by the servers even though I wasn't in their way. They kept kicking my chair and bumping into my shoulder as they passed by. We asked for the check at least 4 times and we were told "it's coming" each time. After 15min, we became impatient and had to ask at the register for it and Christy finally prepared it for another 5min. 

18% gratuity is added to each meal and make sure they give you back the correct change because they tried to tip themselves even more when we paid. 

Don't come here, it's awful.
author: Carmen C.

description:
The hot rolls are the only good thing here.

I ordered the all you can eat menu, there was a nice variety of fish but they all tastes pretty much the same.
author: Jonathan S.

description: Literally the best, all you can eat, made to order, sushi restaurant that I've ever eaten at in San Francisco. It is in a great location and the food is delish!
author: Marco L.

description:
The all you can drink + eat special doesn't include beer.  It only includes sake!

Keep this in mind or else you'll get a $2000+ bill out of the blue.  Yikes.
